result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Van Der Kooy

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Steven J Van Der Kooy.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time for defendant to complete a program for his current extended supervision.
Defense request plea and sentencing date in January.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

9:30 AM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy appeared by video.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Steven J Van Der Kooy.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for some discovery on the newer matter.
State advises it was sent on 8/29/22 and the Defense should receive it soon.
Court addresses motion to modify bond in 22CM1054.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter to Court dated August 26, 2022, requesting zoom appearance for defendant, filed by Atty. Miller

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 27, 2022 - APPROVED.**

Letter to request zoom appearance from Facility, filed by Atty. Miller

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 27, 2022 - APPROVED.**

10:46 AM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests time for defendant to start his ATR and receive treatment.
Court addresses initial appearance on 22CM1054.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to Court dated June 14, 2022 re: Adjournment Request, filed by Atty. Miller
From Probation and Parole re: ATR for defendant
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

02:22 PM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
